text: Dante Leverock (born 11 April 1992) is a Bermudian professional footballer who plays in Poland for Radomiak Radomhttp://bernews.com/2018/12/irish-team-sign- footballer-dante-leverock/ and the Bermuda national team. ==Club career== Leverock played for local side Dandy Town Hornets before joining the Bermuda Hogges in the USL Second Division in summer 2011.Leverock gets call to boost Hogges attack for US trip – Royal Gazette In August 2012, Leverock got himself a scholarship at St. Mary's University College in London, leaving Dandy Town Hornets again for English side Staines Town in the process.Leverock earns UK scholarship – Royal Gazette After picking up an injury he moved to Leatherhead in 2013.Leverock continues Bermuda invasion at Ilkeston – Royal Gazette In winter 2014/15 Leverock trained with Baltimore Blast before joining Harrisburg City Islanders for the 2015 season.Leverock Pleased With Rookie Season In Harrisburg – USL Soccer In 2018, Leverock signed with JK Narva Trans, a professional football club in Estonia, that competes in the highest division of Estonian football. During his first month, Leverock was named by Premium Liiga Soccernet.ee as part of the best eleven players for the month of March. In December 2018, Leverock signed for Sligo Rovers and is a member of the first team squad for the 2019 season. After on season with Rovers, it was announced that Leverock has left the club. After one season in Ireland, Leverock signed for Polish second division side Radomiak Radom in February 2020. == International career == Leverock received his first international cap for Bermuda on 8 March 2015 in a friendly match against Grenada and has, as of June 2019, earned a total of 20 caps, scoring three goals. He has represented his country in 4 FIFA World Cup qualification matches. === International goals === :Scores and results list the Bermuda's goal tally first. {| class="wikitable" ! # !! Date !!
